0DF5D0C74DC54010B7704493915BFA4E.description: Examine selected First Nations, Métis and international Indigenous musicians who challenge societal inequities through music (e.g., treaty education outcome SI11 - analyze how the unfulfilled aspects of treaties, with international Indigenous people, have resulted in inequities).

9222AC15A19D4F4CAEAC907CD1C22F91.description: Examine the connection between cultural identity and music (e.g., reclaiming, preserving and affirming traditions).

AC8FC2D891214AA7B9CF0CC9CCD89540.description: Investigate protocols and traditional/natural laws related to creating and performing music (e.g., gifting of music, cultural appropriation).

67EBA05BF53146C99222966CF81EAB53.description: Research and engage with Elders and local musicians and composers to learn about the role of instrumental music, past and present.

154A69AABF794006AAFD5B1813E2F725.description: Examine First Nations and Métis instrumental music (e.g., powwow social dance music, anthems, Métis kitchen parties, popular music) and its role in communities, past and present.

0ACBD1A8F34E47FC842386702EB0A823.description: Contribute to the process of designing a well-rounded concert program and provide a rationale for choices (e.g., diversity of genres and styles).

53B3C78AB33745F08ABD08ED2116D7F3.description: Discuss characteristics of high-quality repertoire representative of various worldviews (e.g., traditional wind band, gender and sexually diverse composers, Indigenous, self-published, young composers, variety of compositional techniques and devices).

1630D68779944DBEA1E5EA52CE865950.description: Examine characteristics of high quality repertoire in work studied.

8DE0F76F085C4772A336618AB4EE7479.description: Examine and play repertoire that utilizes a variety of compositional techniques and devices.

2CCEBC13D7BE45F6990F1A194DBDF0BA.description: Examine and play a range of repertoire (e.g., traditional wind band, composers of diverse genders, Indigenous, self- published, young composers, variety of genres and styles).

C9757D5807274966A80561A4D07261E5.description: Review and propose characteristics of high quality repertoire.

B0B3254F27004D42AD6F2F2D1FCF2663.description: Examine elements of high quality repertoire.

EBD6DF8793754133AD3F119CE411FBA2.description: Connect composers’ personal experiences to the literature where appropriate.

60CF34D3AAB84461BB7A94982E508F2F.description: Study and/or perform wind band works composed by living composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

95EE663916DA491296C91DDB9F3FA2FC.description: Examine the work of both established and historically under-represented composers (e.g., inclusive of Saskatchewan, Canadian, Indigenous, minority, gender and sexually diverse composers).

EE8478F09E764779A47EFE66AB9DD502.description: Study a variety of Canadian and international music literature of established and historically under-represented composers.

332034DF34BA4BDFB2651F7A2510C84E.description: Explore how evolving technology and media have influenced and changed how music is created, produced, distributed and shared (e.g., instrument evolution, recording, printing press, online music sites).

819CA8C7850141D1B475CE736176BC81.description: Discuss or identify respectful relationships between underrepresented communities and composers.

C9DBBCEBDEA149EE94E77DA2EA14BA3A.description: Examine issues of appropriation in music and identify criteria or ways to determine appropriation.

EF50B32CC2DC4B798E02D8FF87AAA2CC.description: Practice and perform music from various time periods, decades, genres, styles and worldviews.

882AFC278EF847CA9C603D3884577E4A.description: Connect the historical, cultural and social contexts of composers’ lives to the music.

FF5D7345BF274F54B3A7A5F2A5168D25.description: Examine connections between repertoire contexts, time periods and worldviews.

21E38E3B221B4470B035C5ADE8785B72.description: Investigate the purpose and intent of the piece and independently apply this learning to own interpretation.

4FA60489A727442CA73CA93CE7092372.description: Identify musical elements that indicate the music’s context (e.g., instrumentation, style, cultural background).

749B28058C6B476AAFEFFC507DB94E89.description: Examine the historical, cultural and social contexts of repertoire.

1949B4F9335941B4BA1A3183BAEDB6BC.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

A829EA121C274DD99D758B6094514413.description: Apply attained knowledge to improve personal and ensemble performance.

12457979B54A4B51AA7F0E10DD6FD77B.description: Critique performance of others and provide feedback (e.g., What is going well? What could be improved?) using appropriate musical terminology.

FDD7A59B86714386A23EA20769504F47.description: Create a list of specific criteria to use in assessing performances.

C4C65359AB714CCDB9792ADF1729D3B6.description: Listen and respond, with increasing independence, to musical expressions of self and others, conducting critical analysis using musical terminology.

CC9BAA77690545E9A380951CA5062732.description: Recognize the value of music as a life-long source of enjoyment and personal fulfilment.

0FD6962404DB4A819CA7B9C170A0CCDA.description: Broaden musical experience and interests through active participation (e.g., trying different instruments, attending concerts, joining other ensembles).

F0B311F824EB4380BC8FC6500975A7A8.description: Extend understanding of First Nations and Métis music and cultures through dialogue with local Elders or Knowledge Keepers.

F64DAAC70553448D92EE283EC5B18824.description: Engage with local, Saskatchewan and Canadian musicians, including Indigenous musicians, to expand learning opportunities.

4A7907AFFE53444A80C97EFB3F05212B.description: Investigate personal, educational and professional opportunities in music or music-related industries.

55C01C1EE38A447BA98AED756BC4A6A4.description: Investigate the impact and role of music in own life and consider and plan for continuing engagement in music.

74F60C749DAB425D81B35821443E9AFA.description: Describe the development of personal musical skills and knowledge.

E459C882A3CC40B386B588F61603C814.description: Explore various solutions to common musical challenges and goals.

81A2C1A6CE08435D969408569367D402.description: Identify main areas of focus for musical growth and set specific musical goals.

9127E188A0454260B1CD299111F5CF8A.description: Reflect on the input of others (e.g., peers, teacher, adjudicator).

E63701604FFA41DF85E24B9B38DB6E0F.description: Examine own musical expressions, in real time and/or using recording technology, in order to improve through critical self-reflection (e.g., create inquiry questions such as What can I do to get better? How could I change this performance, arrangement or composition?).

1227C65910E747C691A9BE6BDE24FB9D.description: Incorporate, with increased independence, constructive criticism and reflection on personal and group performance.

D490FF2A2E2D4ACC920B8B000F84C34A.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and international artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

8800DAEE29DB4C42B7976CE94E7989B3.description: Demonstrate leadership as a performer by modelling and/or offering assistance, ideas and guidance to other performers during rehearsal/practice.

5C239E858BAC45DBB0821FFEA6F1BBBD.description: Employ rehearsal techniques (e.g., making notes, respectfully providing and applying feedback, making and trying out musical decisions).

58F465761CD54F64BD51A74A91783386.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the skills, attitudes and techniques necessary for ensemble performance.

08F342BB415146A3857E5F13ADC2B796.description: Play in tune with good balance and tone and know the intonation tendencies of one’s instrument.

DC51E4B7103E420288DCF6F8E3658BA6.description: Individually attend to melodic phrasing, rhythmic accuracy and articulation in the preparation and performance of music.

128D291058D348B4A632B0464F76F787.description: Demonstrate the ability to perform the specific tasks particular to the instrument in the ensemble.

74A09F195BE340759B54ECEAED5BE5F1.description: Demonstrate understanding of the function/role of the sections within an ensemble.

988659917A2E477F9A1C764E711B310C.description: Demonstrate complex skills, practices and techniques accurately during ensemble rehearsal and performance.

D3E57BCF4CBC4A979618214AD69A62E8.description: Use technology (e.g., recording or notation) to generate or complement musical material.

9B5D02008F464FCEA6912B9A637B8483.description: Discuss legal and ethical arts practices when composing or arranging (e.g., copyright, plagiarism).

4E1ADACF6B01431986965C9FC58986C0.description: Arrange for a duet or ensemble.

E6EBBB745AB3415CA77E83E93E021E34.description: Articulate what musical elements, techniques, tools, language and practices were used to create the arrangement.

F38F45E0C5764693BD2F64FF1D86279D.description: Experiment with musical elements, techniques, tools, language and practices.

AB6B8700C2A143E8AC09E31B5EFACFFF.description: Arrange a melody on/for own instrument or using technology (e.g., add section into piece, rearrange form, transpose into different key).

2C45CFACA2274F08ACB9C83E2BE757BA.description: Arrange or improvise music for a band instrument.

9FE6C5AD6943449CB87D457AFEF45943.description: Collaborate to determine how the piece will be actualized.

E6A1A40B8BDA487BA76734C6C454C00E.description: Make expressive choices in response to form and structure of the piece.

1B5233EFFFA842B9AD7437CC87A1A632.description: Identify the form and structure of the piece and how they relate to expressive choices.

FC58F6623EEC40F2B59741C7BF8C0EBC.description: Make decision to communicate own intent.

A0BF4017BD0C463FA0F17C02D28DA9FC.description: Make decisions to achieve performing group’s intent.

97A20249C50847D597FE48CAB47C43FF.description: Make decisions to communicate the composer’s intent (e.g., points of tension, phrasing).

219D4EDF5FCC4720B8570E0D013C936E.description: Demonstrate increased ability to make expressive, interpretive and creative choices to communicate music.

613369E84EA5409D95E855CFB4BF3473.description: Refine music reading and writing ability.

7A9B6C606D944EE8AFC4AE307639894B.description: Represent musical ideas of increased complexity using standard notation.

FE1F4CC04A4E4CFC9DED38861208DBEA.description: Use critical thinking to revise, refine and share music through notation.

F2DB8F2EF41D4967A7FA895FCA6626F4.description: Read and interpret, with teacher guidance, standard written musical communication of increasing difficulty.

CB3DD4279D9C4EB39D4C660CDC97B530.description: Interpret and represent, with teacher guidance, notation of increased complexity, including standard music notation, to expressively communicate ideas.

1BA2410CC22041629D6ECC1A972FC845.description: Notate (e.g., traditional, non-traditional, graphic) melodic and rhythmic dictation accurately and with increasing complexity.

D8E04A902EB84537A1AEB1FE201523A3.description: Create and reproduce musical ideas accurately using call and response with increased complexity.

5F76F757F4524F20829C6BC76F51543E.description: Discern pitch variances (e.g., tuning, pitch accuracy, intonation) and make appropriate adjustments.

9BF4808F40DF4D60826B692ED2947579.description: Match musical nuances such as length of note, tone colour and articulations within instrument section and full band.

6A1B2DB03203416F9149A0028A1D1AD2.description: Demonstrate growth towards independence in aural skills related to sectional, ensemble and personal playing.

00F263F4160E48E39ECEE30C3E6F6F45.description: Play batter percussion rudiments including: five-stroke roll, nine-stroke roll, flam, flam tap, flam paradiddle and drag.

D0F3609124CF42DD9D58F519E02F1B91.description: Play chromatic scales in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

8899B14A0EC2409F88681DAA68F1C928.description: Play 9 major and related minor scales using multiple articulation and rhythmic patterns in ranges accessible to the student’s specific instrument.

CFB55CA5A34247FFA511C1484FD5AFF0.description: Demonstrate fluency and proficiency in playing rudiments (i.e., batter percussion) and scales (i.e., wind instruments and mallet percussion) including: 9 major and related minor scales and chromatic scales.

B291793246A24B4C8979B3BAC7B00EA7.description: Explore extended techniques (e.g., vibrato where appropriate, experiment with timbral shading, multiple tonguing).

108FE402C7EC42F1B565A992148043CB.description: Apply accurate articulations (e.g., placement of tongue, attack and release, lengths of notes).

998A066547F448DEBFC31819B7052794.description: Develop further endurance and flexibility in instrument-specific embouchure.

13808F615C2D4C6288ACF6CC33099677.description: Produce resonant tone consistently throughout all registers (e.g., adapt oral cavity).

0984B25CC07B490D8CA14E376ECEF18C.description: Play with correct posture and hand and instrument position.

D4CF742A87DE4755BB632CB1D5319F6F.description: Employ efficient breathing and breath support.

29D37C40D3C841FA8FE35897E1F4BDC9.description: Demonstrate, with some independence, proper instrumental tone and technique.

C71D3A0A83A6477EA62A6434A7392189.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
